trainingCourses.title: Network engineer
trainingCourses.overviewOfRole: Designing, installing, maintaining and supporting communication networks within an organisation or between organisations

trainingCourses.title: Software developer
trainingCourses.overviewOfRole: Building and testing simple, high-quality code for software.

trainingCourses.title: Installation electrician / maintenance electrician
trainingCourses.overviewOfRole: Install, maintain and repair electrical systems in industrial, commercial and domestic environments.

trainingCourses.title: Power network craftsperson
trainingCourses.overviewOfRole: Constructing, maintaining and repairing the UK's electrical power network, providing a safe and reliable supply of electricity to the country

trainingCourses.title: Financial services administrator
trainingCourses.overviewOfRole: Providing administrative support to a financial organisation, to provide a high quality and compliant service.
trainingCourses.keywords: financial planning|mortgage planning|insurance advice|finance|banking|money|admin|office administration|life|pensions|general insurance|investments

trainingCourses.title: Control / technical support engineer (degree)
trainingCourses.overviewOfRole: Assuring that manufacturing runs smoothly in areas such as site maintenance

trainingCourses.title: Electrical / electronic technical support engineer (degree)
trainingCourses.overviewOfRole: Supporting the manufacturing of new products by bringing the product to life and resolving manufacturing problems.

trainingCourses.title: Manufacturing engineer (degree)
trainingCourses.overviewOfRole: Helping take products from design to manufacture, ensuring that they are launched on time, at cost and to the right quality.

trainingCourses.title: Product design and development engineer (degree)
trainingCourses.overviewOfRole: Using engineering techniques to bring new products to life or redesign existing products.

trainingCourses.title: Laboratory technician
trainingCourses.overviewOfRole: Providing routine and one-off testing and technical support in a scientific laboratory environment
coreSkills: Work safely in a laboratory, maintaining excellent housekeeping whilst following appropriate safety, environment and risk management systems.
Follow quality procedures to meet the requirements of quality standards relevant to the workplace.
Prepare for laboratory tasks using the appropriate scientific techniques, procedures and methods
Perform laboratory tasks following specified methodologies, such as Standard Operating Procedures.
Use of specified instrumentation and laboratory equipment, including calibration where required.|Produce reliable, accurate data and keep accurate records of laboratory work undertaken and results.
Analyse, interpret and evaluate data and identify results requiring further investigation seeking advice of senior colleagues as appropriate.
Communicate scientific information appropriately, including the use of Laboratory Information Management systems, either digital or paper based.
Apply scientific techniques for data presentation. e.g. statistics
Recognise problems and apply appropriate scientific methods to identify causes and achieve solutions.
Participate in continuous business performance improvement.
